results.title: The World of David the Gnome
results.creator_credit: Ernest Reid, Ronald A Weinberg, Micheline Charest, Miramax Films and Cinar Films

results.title: The World of David Milne
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly, Colin Low and Gerald Budner
results.brief_description: A lively, exciting experience of art, from the words and paintings of David Milne. “Art”, he said, “isn’t a fire in the grass; it’s an explosion.” Milne’s letters read as a commentary, tell how he felt about what he painted, how he tried to catch the essence of his feelings “before the power ran out…like escaping steam”. We see many of his paintings and a sequence in which we observe the development of his own unique style.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly, Colin Low and Gerald Budner

results.title: The World of CRA
results.brief_description: Views of the varied interests of the group of companies associated with Conzinc Riotinto of Australia. Mining iron at Hamersley; lead, silver and zinc at Broken Hill; aluminium at Weipa; uranium at Rum Jungle; and mineral sands at North Stradbroke Island. Treatment of ores, refining of metals, research and exploration in Australia and New Guinea. Intended to replace the film “Mineral Heritage”, released 1965. Shows Australia’s abundant wealth in minerals, and the part C.R.A plays in mining and processing them. Shows the continuing search for new deposits, especially around Papua and New Guinea and in Bass Strait, and research into the potential of the minerals.

results.title: The World of cashmere
results.creator_credit: Lionel Hoare, British Information Services and Frederick Goode
results.brief_description: The story of cashmere wool from the combing of the strands from the goat’s fleeces in the Himalayas, where the animals are reared to the making of knitted goods at Hawick in Scotland. Concentrates on the manufacturing processes, particularly dyeing, emphasizing the care that is taken throughout to maintain quality.

results.title: The World of animals: looking at amphibians
results.creator_credit: John Walker and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Life Science”.
Studies frogs, toads and salamanders to show how amphibians are adapted to spend their early life in water and their adult life on land. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The World of animals: insects in a garden
results.creator_credit: William Kay and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Life Science”.
Uses time lapse and photomicrography to study various insects on a rose bush - aphids, ants, lacewings, and ladybird beetles. Illustrates states in the life cycle of insects; complete metamorphosis in the lacewing and ladybird beetle and incomplete metamorphosis in the aphid. Shows close-up views of ants protecting aphids from ladybird beetles.

results.title: The World of Andrew Wyeth
results.creator_credit: A Schwartz-Wallace Production, Al Schwartz and Hal Wallace
results.brief_description: An examination of the work of American painter Andrew Wyeth. Over thirty-five paintings are shown. Blending the subjects of the artist’s representational style painting with actual scenes from the Pennsylvania and Maine countryside. The artist’s special vision and technique make the lonely countryside, and gnarled people uniquely his.
